org.grails.datastore.mapping.dynamodb.util
[Java] Interface DynamoDBTemplate

public interface DynamoDBTemplate

AWS DynamoDB template. This is a low-level way of accessing DynamoDB, currently is uses AWS SDK API as the return and parameter types.

Authors:
Roman Stepanenko
Since:
0.1

Method Summary

Blocking call - internally will wait until the table is successfully created and is in ACTIVE state.

Method Detail

createTable

public void createTable(java.lang.String tableName, KeySchema ks, ProvisionedThroughput provisionedThroughput)
Blocking call - internally will wait until the table is successfully created and is in ACTIVE state.
throws:
DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - the table name
ks - the schema
provisionedThroughput - the throughput

deleteAllItems

public boolean deleteAllItems(java.lang.String tableName)
Returns true if any item was deleted, in other words if domain was empty it returns false.
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
Returns:
true if any item was deleted

deleteItem

public void deleteItem(java.lang.String tableName, Key key)
Deletes the specified item with all of its attributes.
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
key - the key for which to retrieve the data

the description

throws:

putItem

public void putItem(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.Map attributes)
Executes 'put' Dynamo DB command, replacing all existing attributes if they exist. http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/LowLevelJavaItemCRUD.html#PutLowLevelAPIJava
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
attributes

putItemVersioned

public void putItemVersioned(java.lang.String tableName, Key key, java.util.Map attributes, java.lang.String expectedVersion, PersistentEntity persistentEntity)
Executes 'put' Dynamo DB command, replacing all existing attributes if they exist. Put is conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking. If the specified expectedVersion does not match what is in dynamoDB, exception is thrown and no changes are made to the dynamoDB http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/LowLevelJavaItemCRUD.html#PutLowLevelAPIJava
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
key
attributes
expectedVersion

scan

public java.util.List scan(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.Map filter, int max)
Executes scan Dynamo DB operation (note this operation does not scale well with the growth of the table).
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
max - maximum amount of items to return (inclusive)
Returns:
the scan results

scanCount

public int scanCount(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.Map filter)
Executes scan Dynamo DB operation and returns the count of matched items (note this operation does not scale well with the growth of the table)
Parameters:
tableName - the table name
filter - filters
Returns:
the count of matched items

updateItem

public void updateItem(java.lang.String tableName, Key key, java.util.Map attributes)
Executes 'update' Dynamo DB command, which can be used to add/replace/delete specified attributes. http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/LowLevelJavaItemCRUD.html#LowLevelJavaItemUpdate
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
key
attributes

updateItemVersioned

public void updateItemVersioned(java.lang.String tableName, Key key, java.util.Map attributes, java.lang.String expectedVersion, PersistentEntity persistentEntity)
Executes 'update' Dynamo DB command, which can be used to add/replace/delete specified attributes. Update is conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking. If the specified expectedVersion does not match what is in dynamoDB, exception is thrown and no changes are made to the dynamoDB http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/LowLevelJavaItemCRUD.html#LowLevelJavaItemUpdate
throws:
org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
Parameters:
tableName - complete name of the table in DynamoDB, will be used as-is
key
attributes
